definitions: strategic placement or arrangement of people, things, or ideas in relation to others
examples: The company's positioning in the market sets it apart from competitors
Careful positioning of the furniture made the room feel more spacious

definitions: quality or state of being positive, optimistic, or constructive in outlook and approach
examples: Her positivity lifted the spirits of everyone in the office
Maintaining positivity during difficult times requires conscious effort and practice

definitions: group of people summoned by sheriff to enforce law
informal group of friends or associates who spend time together
examples: The sheriff assembled a posse to track down the escaped prisoners
The Western movie featured a dramatic posse chase through the desert
She rolled up to the party with her whole posse in tow
His posse of musicians played at local venues every weekend

definitions: grammatical case or form that shows ownership or association
excessive desire to own or control someone or something
examples: The possessive form of 'cat' is 'cat's' when showing ownership
Students often confuse plural and possessive forms in their writing
His possessive behavior was driving away his closest friends
She recognized her possessive tendencies and sought help to change

definitions: person who owns, holds, or has possession of something
examples: The possessor of the winning lottery ticket remained anonymous
As the possessor of rare artifacts, she felt responsible for their preservation

definitions: nocturnal marsupial with pointed snout and prehensile tail found in Americas or Australia
examples: A possum raided our garbage cans last night looking for food
The mother possum carried her babies on her back through the trees

definitions: amount charged for sending mail or packages through postal service
examples: The postage for international letters has increased significantly this year
She forgot to put enough postage on the package and it was returned

definitions: card for sending messages by mail without envelope, typically featuring picture on one side
examples: He sent postcards from every city he visited during his European trip
The vintage postcard collection showed how the town looked a century ago

definitions: series of letters and numbers added to postal address to aid mail sorting
examples: Please include your full postcode when ordering items online for accurate delivery
The postcode system helps postal workers sort mail more efficiently

definitions: researcher working on advanced research after completing doctoral degree, typically temporary position
examples: She accepted a postdoc position at Stanford to continue her cancer research
The postdoc presented groundbreaking findings at the international conference

definitions: relating to academic work or research undertaken after receiving doctoral degree
examples: His postdoctoral fellowship focused on developing sustainable energy solutions
The university offers competitive postdoctoral positions in various scientific fields

definitions: buttocks or rear part of human body
situated behind or at the back of something
examples: The patient complained of pain in the posterior region after the fall
The injection was administered to the posterior muscle for better absorption
The posterior section of the brain controls certain motor functions
In posterior analysis, we discovered flaws in the original hypothesis

definitions: all future generations of people, especially descendants of particular person or group
examples: We must preserve these historical documents for posterity to study and learn
The artist created her masterpiece hoping it would be appreciated by posterity

definitions: student who continues studies after completing first degree, pursuing master's or doctoral degree
examples: The postgraduate program in business administration attracts students from around the world
As a postgraduate, she had access to specialized research facilities

definitions: appointment to particular job, especially in different location
message or article published online or on bulletin board
examples: His military posting took him to bases across three different continents
She received a diplomatic posting to the embassy in Tokyo
The job posting attracted hundreds of qualified applicants within days
Her blog posting about sustainable living went viral on social media

definitions: person employed to deliver mail and packages to homes and businesses
examples: The postman always rings twice when delivering packages that require signatures
Our friendly postman has been delivering mail to this neighborhood for twenty years

definitions: official mark stamped on mail showing place and date of mailing
examples: The postmark proved the letter was sent before the deadline
Collectors value envelopes with rare or historical postmarks

definitions: person in charge of post office or mail distribution center
examples: The postmaster addressed complaints about delayed mail delivery in the district
She worked her way up from mail carrier to become the town's postmaster

definitions: late 20th-century movement in arts, architecture, and criticism departing from modernism through skepticism of grand narratives
examples: Postmodernism challenged traditional notions of objective truth and universal values
The building's design reflects postmodernism with its playful mix of historical styles

definitions: medical examination of dead body to determine cause of death
analysis or discussion of event after it has occurred
examples: The postmortem revealed the victim died from natural causes
The coroner ordered a postmortem to investigate the suspicious death
The team conducted a postmortem to understand why the project failed
Our postmortem meeting identified several areas for improvement

definitions: act of delaying or putting off event or action to later time
examples: The postponement of the concert disappointed thousands of ticket holders
Weather conditions forced the postponement of the outdoor festival until next month

definitions: additional remark at end of letter, introduced by P.S., or added after main content
examples: She added a postscript to her email reminding everyone about the meeting time
The author included an important postscript that changed the meaning of the entire letter

definitions: statement or principle assumed to be true without proof as basis for reasoning
examples: Euclid's geometric postulates form the foundation of classical geometry
The scientist's postulate about dark matter led to groundbreaking research

definitions: position in which someone holds their body when standing or sitting
particular approach or attitude toward something
examples: Good posture prevents back pain and improves overall health
The yoga instructor corrected her students' posture during each pose
The country's defensive posture worried its neighboring nations
The company adopted an aggressive posture toward its competitors

definitions: behavior intended to impress or mislead others through artificial display of attitude or position
examples: Political posturing often obscures the real issues that need addressing
His tough-guy posturing didn't fool anyone who knew his gentle nature

definitions: liquid, especially water, that is safe and suitable for drinking
examples: The hikers carried tablets to make stream water potable during their journey
Access to potable water remains a challenge in many developing regions

definitions: soft silvery-white metallic element essential for plant and animal life, symbol K
examples: Bananas are well known as an excellent source of dietary potassium
The doctor prescribed potassium supplements to address her deficiency

definitions: power or strength of something, especially medicine, drug, or argument to produce effect
examples: The potency of the medication decreases significantly after its expiration date
No one questioned the potency of her arguments during the debate

definitions: hole or depression in road surface caused by wear, weather, or poor construction
examples: The massive pothole on Main Street damaged several cars this week
City workers filled potholes throughout the neighborhood after residents complained

definitions: liquid with healing, magical, or poisonous properties, especially in stories or folklore
examples: The witch brewed a love potion in her cauldron at midnight
In the fantasy game, healing potions restore the player's health instantly

definitions: person who makes pottery by shaping clay and firing it in kiln
examples: The potter demonstrated throwing clay on the wheel at the craft fair
Local potters sell their handmade bowls and vases at the weekend market

definitions: objects made of fired clay such as bowls, plates, and vases
art or craft of making ceramic objects by shaping and firing clay
examples: The museum's pottery collection includes pieces from ancient civilizations
She decorated her kitchen shelves with colorful handmade pottery
Taking pottery classes helped her develop patience and creative skills
The pottery studio offers workshops for beginners every Saturday

definitions: small toilet used by young children during toilet training
examples: Their toddler successfully used the potty for the first time today
We packed a portable potty for our road trip with the kids

definitions: small bag or pocket-like container for carrying things
pocket of skin on animal's body for carrying young
examples: She kept her coins in a small leather pouch attached to her belt
The mail carrier's pouch contained letters and packages for delivery
The kangaroo joey peeked out from its mother's pouch
The pelican stored fish in its throat pouch

definitions: domestic fowl such as chickens, turkeys, ducks, and geese raised for meat or eggs
examples: The farm specializes in free-range poultry and organic vegetables
Poultry must be cooked thoroughly to prevent foodborne illness

definitions: something weighing specified number of pounds
tool or person that pounds or crushes things
examples: He caught a five-pounder while fishing at the lake yesterday
The burger joint is famous for its quarter-pounder with cheese
The chef used a meat pounder to tenderize the steaks
The traditional mortar and pounder are still used for grinding spices

definitions: heavy repeated beating, hitting, or throbbing action or sound
examples: The pounding of waves against the shore could be heard all night
She took aspirin to relieve the pounding headache that had plagued her all day

definitions: boat propelled by motor engine rather than sails or oars
examples: The powerboat raced across the lake at incredible speeds
They rented a powerboat for waterskiing during their vacation

definitions: person, organization, or thing of great energy, strength, or influence in particular field
examples: The tech company became a powerhouse in the artificial intelligence industry
She's a powerhouse athlete who dominates every competition she enters

definitions: any of several diseases causing skin eruption with pustules, especially smallpox or chickenpox
examples: The chickenpox outbreak at the school affected dozens of children
Historical records describe devastating pox epidemics in colonial times

definitions: quality of being suitable for actual use, sensible and realistic rather than idealistic
examples: The practicality of the design made it popular among busy professionals
She valued practicality over aesthetics when choosing her new car

definitions: person who deals with things sensibly and realistically based on practical considerations
examples: As a pragmatic, she focused on solutions that could be implemented immediately
The committee needed a pragmatic who could balance idealism with reality

definitions: approach that evaluates theories or beliefs based on practical application and observable results
examples: Her pragmatism helped the team focus on achievable goals rather than wishful thinking
American pragmatism influenced educational philosophy throughout the twentieth century

definitions: person who approaches situations practically, focusing on what works rather than abstract principles
examples: The pragmatist on the board pushed for cost-effective solutions
As a pragmatist, he believed in testing ideas through real-world application

definitions: large open area of grassland, especially in North America
examples: The pioneers crossed vast prairies in their covered wagons heading west
Prairie wildflowers bloom in spectacular colors during the spring months

definitions: wheeled carriage for baby, pushed by person on foot
examples: She pushed the pram through the park while her baby slept peacefully
The vintage pram had been passed down through three generations

definitions: playful or mischievous trick played on someone for amusement
examples: The harmless prank involved switching the salt and sugar containers
April Fools' Day brings out elaborate pranks from creative jokesters

definitions: person who plays pranks or practical jokes on others
examples: The office prankster struck again, filling cubicles with balloons overnight
Known as the class prankster, he kept everyone laughing with harmless jokes

definitions: edible marine crustacean resembling large shrimp with slender legs and long antennae
examples: The restaurant serves grilled prawns with garlic butter and fresh herbs
Fresh prawns from the local market made the perfect addition to the paella
